meanings.definition: Any of a group of simple proteins soluble in salt solutions and forming a large fraction of blood serum protein.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that globulin is a type of protein found in the blood.
meanings.sent2: The globulin levels in the blood can indicate certain health conditions.
meanings.sent3: When the globulin protein heard a joke, it dissolved in laughter.
meanings.sent4: The importance of globulin in the blood is like a key player in a team, essential for overall performance.
meanings.sent5: Imagine globulin as a tiny soldier fighting off invaders in your bloodstream.

meanings.definition: A protein in the blood that helps fight infection and disease.
meanings.sent1: Globulin plays a crucial role in protecting the body from illnesses.
meanings.sent2: During an infection, the immune system produces more globulin to combat the threat.
meanings.sent3: The globulin protein high-fived the white blood cells for their teamwork in fighting off germs.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against sickness, globulin acts as a shield, defending the body from harm.
meanings.sent5: Visualize globulin as a superhero swooping in to save the day from harmful invaders.
